newsitem.title: USA: Fed adds reserves with funds below target.
newsitem.headline: Fed adds reserves with funds below target.

text.p: The Federal Reserve added temporary reserves to the U.S. banking system on Thursday via $1.0 billion customer repurchase agreements, despite a lower federal funds rate, a Fed spokesman said.

The overnight bank lending, or federal funds rate, was trading at 5-1/16 percent shortly before the Fed entered the market. Earlier Thursday, funds were at 5.0 percent. They closed at 5.5 percent on Wednesday and averaged 4.96 percent.
Economists had expected the Fed to stay out of the market given what they believed to be an apparent abundance of funds.
